entry.title: DRACO Welcomes 3 New Undergraduate Researchers
entry.content: Welcome our our three new undergraduates Kate, Franco, and Francisco. who joined DRACO during the Spring 2024 semester. Francisco is funded through an AMD Fellowship!
entry.summary: Welcome our our three new undergraduates Kate, Franco, and Francisco. who joined DRACO during the Spring 2024 semester. Francisco is funded through an AMD Fellowship!

entry.title: Two Journal of Cybersecurity Publications in 2023!

link.title: Two Journal of Cybersecurity Publications in 2023!

entry.content:
Two Side Channel publications published in the open-access Journal of Cybersecurity & privacy in Summer and Fall of 2023!

The papers include:

  • Clay Carper, Stone Olguin, Jarek Brown, Caylie Charlton, and Mike Borowczak. 2023. “Challenging Assumptions of Normality in AES s-Box Configurations under Side-Channel Analysis” Journal of Cybersecurity and Privacy 3, no. 4: 844-857. https://doi.org/10.3390/jcp3040038
  • Andey Robins, Stone Olguin, Jarek Brown, Clay Carper, and Mike Borowczak. 2023. “Power-Based Side-Channel Attacks on Program Control Flow with Machine Learning Models” Journal of Cybersecurity and Privacy 3, no. 3: 351-363. https://doi.org/10.3390/jcp3030018
entry.summary: Two Side Channel publications published in the open-access Journal of Cybersecurity & privacy in Summer and Fall of 2023!

entry.title: Redefining Value & Risk Invited Talk @ AIU

link.title: Redefining Value & Risk Invited Talk @ AIU

entry.content: Dr. Borowczak was an invited panelist and speaker at the 1st annual “AI and Cybersecurity GCC Forum” hosted by the American International University, Kuwait. His message focused on recognizing the shifting of value from raw data to AI-derived models and the implications on where future risk might exist, especially in edge-devices (e.g., Smart Cities, IoT, autonomous vehicles).
entry.summary: Dr. Borowczak was an invited panelist and speaker at the 1st annual “AI and Cybersecurity GCC Forum” hosted by the American International University, Kuwait. His message focused on recognizing the shifting of value from raw data to AI-derived models and the implications on where future risk might exist, especially in edge-devices (e.g., Smart Cities, IoT, autonomous vehicles).

entry.title: DRACO Welcomes 10 Undergraduate Researchers
entry.content:
Welcome to our 2023-2024 Undergraduate cohort of student researchers starting in Fall. The new members are:

  • Arturo
  • Jarred
  • Joshua
  • Lana **AMD Undergraduate Fellow

entry.title: DRACO Welcomes Andey & Jenna
entry.content: DRACO is pleased to welcome two graduate students! Welcome Andey Robins (Ph.D Student) and Jenna Goodrich (MS Student).
